title: How to Enable and Disable Split Screen on an iPad: Easy Guide

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon. If you don't want the multitasking (split screen) feature, you can disable it entirely. Multitasking is enabled by default, and it can be used in either orientation . Be sure to update your device . You must have at least iPadOS 17 to disable this feature. If your iPad is older , you can close Split Screen by dragging the divider to either end of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Multitasking & Gestures.
steps.content: Tap Multitasking & Gestures . You can find this in the left panel, underneath Home Screen & App Library .

steps.title: Tap Off under "Multitasking".
steps.content: Tap Off under "Multitasking". This is the first option on the left. The changes will be applied immediately. If you have any active split screens, they'll be separated into their individual app windows.

steps.title: Open an app.
steps.content: Open an app . This can be any app that supports split screen. Make sure this feature is enabled in your settings. Tap Settings > Multitasking & Gestures > Split View & Slide Over .

steps.title: Tap the Multitasking button at the top.
steps.content: Tap the Multitasking button at the top. This is the three dots at the very top of the app. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Split View.
steps.content: Tap Split View . This is the second option. Alternatively, you can tap Slide Over if you want this app to open in a separate panel on top of another app.

steps.title: Select another app.
steps.content: Select another app. You can browse your Home screen , Dock, or App Library. The apps will open in split view with the first app on the left and the second app on the right. To rearrange the app, tap the Multitasking icon above either app. Tap Split VIew , and then select Left Split or Right Split . To return to full-screen mode, tap the Multitasking icon above either app, and tap Full Screen . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Use the drag method (optional).
steps.content: Use the drag method (optional). If you don't want to use the Multitasking icon, you can drag an app to split view instead. Do the following: Open an app. From the Dock, tap, hold, and drag another app to the left or right of the screen.
